text: I heard rumor that in NZ they provide the quarantine accommodation for you when you get there

text: They used to in Australia but they stopped providing it in July and started charging for it

text: In China they also charge for it, but less than Australia does

attachments.title: Charges for managed isolation | Managed isolation and quarantine
attachments.text: The government will be recovering some of the costs for managed isolation to share the costs in a way that fairly reflects the benefits to both the New Zealand public of having a robust system, and those who leave and enter the country.
attachments.fallback: Charges for managed isolation | Managed isolation and quarantine

text: About the same as Australia there.

elements.text: About the same as Australia there.

text: Ah in NZ it is free if you are staying for more than 90 days.

elements.text: Ah in NZ it is free if you are staying for more than 90 days.

text: yeah for citizens and residents returning from overseas

elements.text: yeah for citizens and residents returning from overseas

text: In Australia non-citizens/permanent residents are not allowed in. (except for exceptions)

elements.text: In Australia non-citizens/permanent residents are not allowed in. (except for exceptions)

text: hehe, that makes a lot of sense, travelers have been the worst cause of infections here

elements.text: hehe, that makes a lot of sense, travelers have been the worst cause of infections here

text: it's a constant trickle of people flying in and then testing positive, like seriously?

elements.text: it's a constant trickle of people flying in and then testing positive, like seriously?

text: NZ treats permanent residents pretty much like citizens. Non-residents are not allowed in either (except the exceptions, of course).

elements.text: NZ treats permanent residents pretty much like citizens. Non-residents are not allowed in either (except the exceptions, of course).

text: Re the trickle: yes, in NZ. We get 5-10 cases every day basically in managed isolation. But the quarantine system works well, so there have been very few outbreaks, and those have been contained quickly.

elements.text: Re the trickle: yes, in NZ. We get 5-10 cases every day basically in managed isolation. But the quarantine system works well, so there have been very few outbreaks, and those have been contained quickly.

text: You can look at the ministry of health media release headlines for example: <https://www.health.govt.nz/news-media/media-releases>
